item.title: Notes: Veletsianos-2015-Interdisciplinarity in MOOC research and its changes over time
item.description: References Citekey: @Veletsianos2015-hd Veletsianos, G., & Shepherdson, P. (2015). Who studies MOOCs? Interdisciplinarity in MOOC research and its changes over time. The International Review of Research in. Retrieved from http://www.irrodl.org/index.php/irrodl/article/view/2202 Notes Summarize: This study builds on earlier studies of the MOOC literature, but with a special focus (on interdisciplnarity) and a different approach. Briefly, it studies the scope of the literature from 2013-2015; it uses author affiliation as a proxy for Interdisciplinarity; it covers a broad range of literature extracted from multiple indices; it relies on descriptive and inferential statistics (Chi-square) to describe interdisciplinarityand compare it with data from earlier studies.
